intro: Apinagia crispa, commonly known as the wrinkled apinagia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like China and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive wavy or wrinkled texture, which gives it its common name. Apinagia crispa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in acidic soils.
